definition: to escape unscathed/to get through in one piece
all/whole/entire/every/complete
surname Quan
body/life/oneself/personally/one's morality and conduct/the main part of a structure or body/pregnant/classifier for sets of clothes: suit, twinset/Kangxi radical 158
and/as well as/and so/but (not)/yet (not)/(indicates causal relation)/(indicates change of state)/(indicates contrast)
to retreat/to decline/to move back/to withdraw

sentences.english: Not seeking to get out, just leave the whole body.
sentences.chinese: 不求全身而退，只求留有全屍。

sentences.english: Since you have not retreats, I also have to bite the bullet and joined in.
sentences.chinese: 既然已經無法全身而退了，我也只好硬着頭皮參加了。

sentences.english: If badly wounded, Nefarian uses his powerful magic to retreat.
sentences.chinese: 如果身附重傷，奈法利安會用他強大的魔法全身而退。

sentences.english: He didn't intend to get out, just want to help the re break the curse.
sentences.chinese: 他本就沒打算能全身而退，只希望幫重暄解開詛咒。

sentences.english: And you also need to acquire whatever skills and resources are necessary to make withdrawals.
sentences.chinese: 你還需要獲得那些讓你可以全身而退的技術和資源。

definition: to get away/to escape (from obligations)/to free oneself/to disengage
to beat comfortably/to win easily/abbr. for 穩操勝券|稳操胜券, to have victory within one's grasp
to run away/to escape
to turn defeat into victory (idiom); to turn the tide
everything bodes ill, no positive signs (idiom); inauspicious/everything points to disaster
to defeat/to smash/to rout
powerful enemy
to beat back/to repel
to defend oneself/self-defense/self-preservation
luckily/by a fluke
to preserve/to save
to get rid of
to force one's way out of encirclement/to break through
to besiege/to beleaguer/to attack from all sides/to jointly speak or write against sb
to fight with all one's might
to suffer a defeat/to fail/to fall behind
